resources.string: We have sent a 6-digit OTP to your email
2FA verification by OTP will be sent via email. Please check and key in the OTP

1. Collection of Personal Data
We collect and store personal data, including biometric data, email, and authentication credentials, solely for the purpose of authentication and account security.

2. Purpose of Data Collection
Your data will be used only for:
- User authentication and login security
- Access control to restricted app features
- Compliance with security regulations

3. Consent and Withdrawal
By agreeing to these Terms & Conditions, you consent to the collection and use of your data. You may withdraw your consent at any time by contacting our Data Protection Officer (DPO) at dpo@example.com.

4. Data Protection and Retention
We implement strict security measures (encryption, access control) to protect your data. Data will be retained for as long as required by law or until you delete your account.

5. Sharing of Data
Your data will not be shared with third parties except when necessary for security or legal compliance.

6. Access and Correction of Data
You may request to access or correct your personal data by contacting our DPO.

7. Governing Law
These terms comply with the Personal Data Protection Act (PDPA) of Singapore.
I Agree to the Terms & Conditions

Imagine your phone is using facial recognition to unlock — when it sees your real face, it’s seeing a live, breathing human with tiny movements like blinking, smiling, and head tilts. That’s what we call a genuine face — it has depth, reacts to lighting naturally, and moves in real time.
Now picture someone trying to trick the system using a photo of your face, or maybe even a video on another screen — that’s a spoofed face. Spoofing is basically pretending to be someone else to fool facial recognition. It could be a flat picture, a screen recording, or even a creepy 3D mask. These are common tactics used in biometric attacks
